quote: Democrats purposely misstated Medicaid under new Senate bill - actually goes up.
quotePlain: Democrats purposely misstated Medicaid under new Senate bill - actually goes up.
name: Donald Trump

checks.quote: … if the Senate bill as written by the date of his tweet becomes law, federal spending would be reduced by $772 billion over 10 years, according to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office. Moreover, 15 million fewer people would be enrolled in the program over 10 years than would be under current law.
checks.quotePlain: … if the Senate bill as written by the date of his tweet becomes law, federal spending would be reduced by $772 billion over 10 years, according to the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office. Moreover, 15 million fewer people would be enrolled in the program over 10 years than would be under current law.

claims.title: the Senate healthcare bill (BCRA) increases medicaid spending
claims.negative: the Senate healthcare bill (BCRA) does not increase medicaid spending
claims.negativePlain: the Senate healthcare bill (BCRA) does not increase medicaid spending
claims.truth: The Senate bill significantly reduces how much the federal government would spend on Medicaid in future years compared to projections without a change in the current law.
claims.truthPlain: The Senate bill significantly reduces how much the federal government would spend on Medicaid in future years compared to projections without a change in the current law.
